Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; two white bands below; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of bull’s head, to right.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 255, no. 444, pl. 60) (incorrectly labelled as 1888.6-1.471.c.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0521) (phase 2)
